alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 3:03PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Morgan, northwestern Breathitt, western Magoffin, east central Lee and southeastern Wolfe Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fillmore, or 8 miles east of Beattyville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lawson around 310 PM EDT. Bethany, Hollonville, Lane, Pence and Vancleve around 315 PM EDT. Paxton, Wilhurst and Landsaw around 320 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Simpson, Lexie, Malaga, Moct, Upper Gilmore, Gilmore, Rosefork, Shockey, Lower Gilmore, Lee City, Adele, Belknap, Helechawa, Burkhart, Sellars, Cannel City, Burg, Netty, Wheel Rim, Payton, Cutuno and Lizzielane. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 51 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
